page.title: 11ASHDOWN FOREST RECREATION
page.content: There are those who come for more energetic and serious recreation. Rambling clubs may travel from as far away as Eastbourne and walk 12 miles or so. The Wealdenway long distance footpath passes through the area. It is good country for horse-riding except in very wet weather but riders must have permits and keep to the marked bridleways. Sometimes there are sponsored walks or rides for charity. Hunting is allowed. Motor-bikes are not. After a heavy fall of snow toboganning is popular and a few skiers generally appear. Orienteering, flying model remote control gliders, dog-training, bird-watching, pigeon-racing and fishing (by special permission in Pippingford Park) are among the hobbies which attract enthusiasts to this part of the Forest.
